cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend with an eventual turn NE up the Southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (Suwannee River to Mexico Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet including Pamlico Sound; Anclote River to Suwannee River FL; West of Mexico Beach to Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.warning_coast: Englewood FL to Suwannee River FL; West of Mexico Beach to Walton/Bay County line; Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast Big Bend, Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts with effects spreading northward along the mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may bring brief squalls with gusts 25–35 mph; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at PortMiami.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at PortMiami; surge forecast 1–3 ft begins north of the Florida-Georgia line.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of intermittent rainfall possible from outer bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado threat confined to north Florida and southeast Georgia – not expected near PortMiami.
